Greatest Akokites, Let's celebrate Mrs. Didi Esther Walson-Jack, OON, mni, on her appointment as the Head of Civil Service of the Federation by President Bola Tinubu, effective August 14, 2024. Previously, she served as the Permanent Secretary of the Federal Ministry of Education. A University of Lagos law graduate, Mrs. Walson-Jack was called to the Nigerian Bar in 1987. Her distinguished public service career spans decades, beginning as a State Counsel in the Rivers State Ministry of Justice. She played a pivotal role in establishing the legal and administrative frameworks of Bayelsa State after its creation in 1996. As the state‚Äôs only certified Legal Drafter, she led the drafting of all edicts and executive bills during the formative years of Bayelsa's governance. At the federal level, Mrs. Walson-Jack was appointed Permanent Secretary by President Muhammadu Buhari in 2017, serving in various capacities across ministries, including the Service Welfare Office, Ministry of Niger Delta Affairs, Power, Water Resources, and Sanitation. Her leadership was also notable during her secondment to Bayelsa State, where she held key roles such as Deputy Chief of Staff and Commissioner of Science, Technology, and Manpower Development. Mrs. Walson-Jack‚Äôs contributions have earned her numerous accolades, including the African Iconic Female Administrator of the Year (2024) and Public Administrator of the Year for Bayelsa State (2008). She is a member of the National Institute for Policy and Strategic Studies (NIPSS) and is an accomplished author, with her best-selling autobiography, ‚ÄúRoses in the Thorns,‚Äù chronicling her journey of resilience and triumph. As she assumes leadership of the Civil Service of the Federation, we wish her wisdom in guiding the Civil Service to greater heights. On behalf of the President (Worldwide), National Executive Committee (NEC), Board of Trustees and Akokites around the globe, we celebrate this Distinguished Akokite! Congratulations, Ma! Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary

Greatest Akokites, Let's celebrate with Lieutenant Colonel Olubukola Olusanya, Commanding Officer, 232 Battalion, (Operation Lafia Dole) as he hits the Golden age. Lt. Col. Olusanya, a graduate of Building from the prestigious University of Lagos has taken part in several local and international military operations in Nigeria's Niger Delta, Liberia and the Darfur region in Sudan. He contributes to the defense of the Nigeria entity by combating the dreaded Boko Haram insurgents in Adamawa State. On this special occasion of your golden jubilee celebration, we pray for God's protection and guidance in your endeavours. Wishing you more glorious years ahead. From all of us, Happy 50th birthday! Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary

Greatest Akokites, Few days ago, Dr. Daniel K. Olukoya, a Distinguished Akokite received a Lifetime Achievement Award from President Joe Biden of the United States of America. Dr. Olukoya, the first Nigerian scientist to clone genes, bagged this enviable award alongside his wife, Mrs. Shade Olukoya in Houston, Texas on Sunday, August 4th, 2024. The award of honour was presented by an official representative of Biden at the Mountain of Fire and Miracles Ministries (MFM) U.S headquarters. The prestigious award acknowledges the ministry‚Äôs outstanding contributions to community development in the United States and its tireless efforts in improving lives. Congratulations to a priestly scholar, renowned researcher, achiever and global influencer. We are proud of you, sir! Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary

Greatest Akokites, Starting from tomorrow, friends and family will commence activities to bid farewell to a renowned lawyer, entrepreneur, and Senior Advocate of Nigeria, Prince Uchenna Gregory Nwokedi, SAN, KSS, - Principal Partner, Uchenna Nwokedi Chambers. A 1982 graduate of Law, University of Lagos, he passed on 28th June, 2024 in the United Kingdom after a brief illness. He will be fondly remembered as one of the leading commercial lawyers in Nigeria with expertise in commercial litigation and international commercial arbitration. He was also a playwright. The President (Worldwide), National Executive Committee (NEC), Board of Trustees and entire members of the association join the family to mourn the passing of this giant. May his soul rest in perfect peace. Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary

Owootori, one of the members of the Alumni Legal team who wears many hats as far as the Alumni is concerned. üëâ Ex National Internal Auditor, üëâ Ex.National Sec., Ex 3rd National Vice President, üëâEx National VP Sir, we wish you a happy birthday and take this moment to thank you for your selfless service to our great Association. Greatest Akokites, On behalf of the President (Worldwide), National Executive Council (NEC), members of the Board of Trustees and teeming members of the UNILAG Alumni Association, we proudly celebrate a distinguished Akokite, who is making us proud in her chosen field of endeavour. Here's a hearty birthday greetings to Her Excellency, H.E Ambassador Prof. Olufolake Abdulrazaq (aka Mama Kwara), the First Lady of Kwara State. Seasoned diplomat, academic and technocrat, she has for over 31 years served meritoriously in the field of Foreign Affairs and diplomacy and has etched a name for herself. She is also a humanitarian and philanthropist par excellence. This and many more informed her nomination and decoration as a Distinguished Alumnus of our great University during the Unilag Alumni Association's UNILAG AT 60 Gala Night in 2022. Today on your 57th birthday, we join His Excellency, the Governor, your family, friends and associates to celebrate with you. Here's wishing you more beautiful years ahead. Happy Birthday from all of us! Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary

Greatest Akokites, Today, we celebrate a remarkable individual, Mr. Rasulu Taiwo, the National Financial Secretary of the UNILAG Alumni Association. He is a senior staff member of the Lagos State Service Commission, an esteemed author, and a seasoned professional accountant, Mr. Taiwo‚Äôs dedication and expertise have made a significant impact in every role he undertakes especially as it concerns the Alumni association. A graduate of Accounting of our prestigious alma mater, he is an expert in Financial Reporting and Analysis, Forensic Accounting and Investigation, Management Consulting Services, Financial Modelling,System Auditing, Integrated Business Solutions. Your commitment to excellence and your unwavering integrity inspire us all. Dear NFS, may this special day be filled with joy, laughter, and cherished moments with loved ones. Here's to another year of success, happiness, and impact! Happy Birthday, dear brother! üéÇüéà Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary

Greatest Akokites, Happy 79th Birthday to Barr. Gbolahan Karounwi Olufon, 5th President, University of Lagos Alumni Association who served between 1982-1984. A 1970 graduate of Law from University of Lagos, he became the first Company Secretary of CHASE Merchant Bank, Nigeria's first investment bank in 1978 and rose to become General Manager (Legal) in 1981. He is currently the Principal Partner of G. K. OLUFON Chambers, a legal practice firm in Lagos and Chairman, G.K.O. Holdings Limited. Baba Olufon is a man of probity, integrity and honesty. He is renowned for his role in saving the job of over 5000 Nigerians in the defunct Nigerian Textile Mill by scuttling the fraudulent sale process. He also launched his autobiography MY EARLY LIFE STORY. We celebrate this icon. May the Almighty continue to strengthen and preserve you. Happy birthday Sir. We love you! Funmi Falobi National Publicity Secretary
